Outer function reference

Analysis

ab01nd(n,m,A,B,[jobz,tol,ldwork])

To find a controllable realization for the linear time-invariant multi-input system

ab04md()

ab05md(...)

To obtain the state-space model (A,B,C,D) for the cascaded inter-connection of two systems, each given in state-space form.

ab05nd(...)

To obtain the state-space model (A,B,C,D) for the feedback inter-connection of two systems, each given in state-space form.

ab07nd(n,m,A,B,C,D,[ldwork])

To compute the inverse (A_i,B_i,C_i,D_i) of a given system (A,B,C,D).

ab08nd(n,m,p,A,B,C,D,[equil,tol,ldwork])

To construct for a linear multivariable system described by a state-space model (A,B,C,D) a regular pencil (Af - lambda*Bf ) which has the invariant zeros of the system as generalized eigenvalues.

ab08nz(n,m,p,A,B,C,D,[equil,tol,lzwork])

To construct for a linear multivariable system described by a state-space model (A,B,C,D) a regular pencil (Af - lambda*Bf ) which has the invariant zeros of the system as generalized eigenvalues.

ab09ad(...)

Compute reduced order State-Space-Model (Ar, Br, Cr) for a stable system (A, B, C) by using either the square-root or the balancing-free square- root Balance & truncate (B & T) model reduction method.

ab09ax(dico, job, n, m, p, A, B, C[, nr, ...])

nr,Ar,Br,Cr,hsv,T,Ti = ab09ad(dico,job,equil,n,m,p,nr,A,B,C,[nr,tol,ldwork])

ab09bd(...)

To compute a reduced order model (Ar,Br,Cr,Dr) for a stable original state-space representation (A,B,C,D) by using either the square-root or the balancing-free square-root Singular Perturbation Approximation (SPA) model reduction method.

ab09md(...)

To compute a reduced order model (Ar,Br,Cr) for an original state-space representation (A,B,C) by using either the square-root or the balancing-free square-root Balance & Truncate (B & T) model reduction method for the ALPHA-stable part of the system.

ab09nd(...)

To compute a reduced order model (Ar,Br,Cr,Dr) for an original state-space representation (A,B,C,D) by using either the square-root or the balancing-free square-root Singular Perturbation Approximation (SPA) model reduction method for the alpha-stable part of the system.

ab13bd(dico, jobn, n, m, p, A, B, C, D, [tol])

To compute the H2 or L2 norm of the transfer-function matrix G of the system (A,B,C,D).

ab13dd(dico, jobe, equil, jobd, n, m, p, A, ...)

To compute the L-infinity norm of a continuous-time or discrete-time system, either standard or in the descriptor form,

ab13ed(n, A, [tol])

To estimate beta(A), the 2-norm distance from a real matrix A to the nearest complex matrix with an eigenvalue on the imaginary axis.

ab13fd(n, A, [tol])

To compute beta(A), the 2-norm distance from a real matrix A to the nearest complex matrix with an eigenvalue on the imaginary axis.

ab13md(Z, nblock, itype, [x])

Find an upper bound for the structured singular value of complex matrix Z and given block diagonal structure.

Mathematical routines

mc01td(dico, dp, p)

To determine whether or not a given polynomial P(x) with real coefficients is stable, either in the continuous-time or discrete- time case.

mb03rd(n, A, [X, jobx, sort, pmax, tol])

To reduce a matrix A in real Schur form to a block-diagonal form using well-conditioned non-orthogonal similarity transformations.

mb03vd(n, ilo, ihi, A)

To reduce a product of p real general matrices A = A_1*A_2*...*A_p to upper Hessenberg form, H = H_1*H_2*...*H_p, where H_1 is upper Hessenberg, and H_2, ..., H_p are upper triangular, by using orthogonal similarity transformations on A,

mb03vy(n, ilo, ihi, A, Tau, [ldwork])

To generate the real orthogonal matrices Q_1, Q_2, ..., Q_p, which are defined as the product of ihi-ilo elementary reflectors of order n, as returned by SLICOT Library routine MB03VD:

mb03wd(job, compz, n, ilo, ihi, iloz, ihiz, ...)

To compute the Schur decomposition and the eigenvalues of a

mb05md(a, delta[, balanc])

Matrix exponential for a real non-defective matrix

mb05nd(n, a, delta[, tol])

To compute

Synthesis

sb01bd(n,m,np,alpha,A,B,w,dico,[tol,ldwork])

To determine the state feedback matrix F for a given system (A,B) such that the closed-loop state matrix A+B*F has specified eigenvalues.

sb02md(dico,n,A,G,Q,[hinv,uplo,scal,sort,ldwork])

To solve for X either the continuous-time algebraic Riccati equation

sb02mt(n,m,B,R,[A,Q,L,fact,jobl,uplo,ldwork])

To compute the following matrices

sb02od(...)

To solve for X either the continuous-time algebraic Riccati equation

sb03md(n,C,A,U,dico,[job,fact,trana,ldwork])

Deprecated since version 0.5.

sb03md57(A[, U, C, dico, job, fact, trana, ...])

To solve for X either the real continuous-time Lyapunov equation

sb03od(dico,n,m,A,Q,B,[fact,trans,ldwork])

To solve for X = op(U)'*op(U) either the stable non-negative definite continuous-time Lyapunov equation

sb04md(n,m,A,B,C[,ldwork])

To solve for X the continuous-time Sylvester equation

sb04qd(n,m,A,B,C[,ldwork])

To solve for X the discrete-time Sylvester equation

sb10ad(...)

To compute the matrices of an H-infinity optimal n-state controller

sb10dd(...)

To compute the matrices of an H-infinity (sub)optimal n-state controller

sb10fd(...)

To compute the matrices of an H-infinity (sub)optimal n-state controller

sb10hd(n,m,np,ncon,nmeas,a,b,c,d,[tol,ldwork])

To compute the matrices of the H2 optimal n-state controller

sg02ad(...)

To solve for X either the continuous-time algebraic Riccati equation

sg03ad(...)

To solve for X either the generalized continuous-time Lyapunov equation

sg03bd(dico,n,m,A,E,Q,Z,B,[fact,trans,ldwork])

To compute the Cholesky factor U of the matrix X,

Transformation Routines

tb01id(n,m,p,maxred,A,B,C,[job])

To reduce the 1-norm of a system matrix

tb03ad(n,m,p,A,B,C,D,leri,[equil,tol,ldwork])

To find a relatively prime left or right polynomial matrix representation with the same transfer matrix as that of a given state-space representation, i.e. if leri = 'L'.

tb04ad(n,m,p,A,B,C,D,[tol1,tol2,ldwork])

Convert a state-space system to a tranfer function or matrix of transfer functions.

tb05ad(n, m, p, jomega, A, B, C[, job])

To find the complex frequency response matrix (transfer matrix) G(freq) of the state-space representation (A,B,C) given by

tc04ad(m,p,index,pcoeff,qcoeff,leri,[ldwork])

To find a state-space representation (A,B,C,D) with the same transfer matrix as that of a given left or right polynomial matrix representation, i.e.

tc01od(m, p, indlim, pcoeff, qcoeff, leri)

To find the dual right (left) polynomial matrix representation of a given left (right) polynomial matrix representation, where the right and left polynomial matrix representations are of the form Q(s)*inv(P(s)) and inv(P(s))*Q(s) respectively.

tf01md(n, m, p, N, A, B, C, D, u, x0)

To compute the output sequence of a linear time-invariant open-loop system given by its discrete-time state-space model

tf01rd(n,m,p,N,A,B,C,[ldwork])

To compute N Markov parameters M_1, M_2,..., M_N from the parameters (A,B,C) of a linear time-invariant system, where each M_k is an p-by-m matrix and k = 1,2,...,N.

td04ad(...)

Convert a transfer function or matrix of transfer functions to a minimum state space realization.

tb01pd(n,m,p,A,B,C,[job,equil,tol,ldwork])

To find a reduced (controllable, observable, or minimal) state- space representation (Ar,Br,Cr) for any original state-space representation (A,B,C).
